title: Another weekend of bloodshed on London streets ends in stabbing of teen boy
text:
A 20-year-old man was stabbed to death in Bexley on Sunday (Picture: LNP)

A teenage boy and a man were stabbed in separate attacks just streets apart last night as a weekend of bloodshed came to a close.

A spate of stabbings across the capital saw one victim, 20, stabbed to death and a number of other victims fighting for their lives

Police arrested a teenager, 17, after the killing in Bexley, southeast London, on Sunday afternoon.

The victim was taken to an east London hospital where he died.

Last night, a teenage boy and a man were stabbed in separate incidents in Haringey, north London, the Metropolitan Police said.

Officers were called to Sycamore Gardens, Tottenham, at 10.18pm to reports of a stabbing and found the injured teenager.

He was treated at the scene and taken by London Ambulance Service to hospital. His condition is not known.

Then at 10.41pm, officers were called to Herbert Road, Tottenham, where they found a man in his 20s with stab injuries.

Earlier on Sunday, two men were knifed in a double stabbing at a local butchers shop in Tottenham, north London (Picture: Getty)

Paramedics treated him at the scene and took him to hospital. His condition is also unknown.

Crime scenes remain in place and MPS Haringey have put a section 60 order in place until 1pm today giving police expanded stop and search powers.

The separate stabbings came hours after two men were knifed outside a butcher’s shop in Tottenham on Sunday morning.

The men, aged 40 and 29, were found with knife wounds outside West Green Halal Meat and Groceries store but their injuries are not life-threatening, police said.

Elsewhere in the city, a man thought to be in his early 20s was stabbed several times at Westfield Shopping Centre in Shepherd’s Bush on Saturday evening.

His injuries are not life-threatening, the force said.

Mohammed Alinoor Uddin, 36, of Tower Hamlets, was charged with attempted murder after a stabbing in Whitechapel, east London, on Saturday (Picture: LNP)

Meanwhile Mohammed Alinoor Uddin, 36, of Tower Hamlets, was charged with attempted murder after a stabbing in Whitechapel, east London.

He was also charged with possession of an offensive weapon and assaulting an emergency worker, Scotland Yard said.

Police were called to Turner Street at 2.05pm on Saturday to reports of men fighting.

One victim, 34, was found with stab wounds and taken to an east London hospital where he is in a critical but stable condition, the Met police said.

Another man, 37, was also arrested on suspicion of attempted murder and has since been released and remains under investigation.

Uddin is due to appear in Thames Magistrates’ Court on Monday.

Baptista Adjei, 15, was found fatally stabbed outside Stratford Broadway in east London on Thursday (Picture: PA)

It comes days after two teenagers were stabbed to death within hours of each other in the capital city.

Baptista Adjei, 15, was killed after getting off a bus which stopped near to Stratford Shopping Centre on Thursday afternoon.

A 15-year-old boy has been charged with his murder and will appear at Stratford Youth Court today.

Around five hours after Baptista’s death, another teenager, 18, was stabbed to death in a separate incident in Camberwell, south London.

description: The capital saw a spate of stabbings culminating in a teenage boy and a man being stabbed in separate incidents just streets apart.
